6.1 Working with the Project Management APIs - Reference Documentation

Authors: Microsoft Corporation

Version: 8.0.0

Table of Contents

6.1/r/project/create
6.2/r/project/pool
6.3/r/project/recycle
6.4/r/project/list
6.5/r/project/ping

6.14/r/project/delete

6.1 Working with the Project Management APIs

The project management APIs facilitate basic lifecycle management for projects.

Live Projects

A live project is any project, temporary or persistent, that is actively in use on the DeployR grid. By definition, all temporary projects are live projects. A user can have zero, one or more projects live on the grid at any one time.

To ensure a fair distribution of server runtime resources across all users the DeployR administrator can limit the number of live projects permitted for a given user at any one time. When a user reaches his or her live project limit all further API calls on new projects are rejected until one or more of that user's current live projects are closed using the /r/project/close call. Calls that are rejected due to live project limits will indicate an appropriate Grid Resource Error on the response code.

Creating Projects

There are a number of ways to create projects on the API, including the following:

  1. Create a new project using the /r/project/create call.
  2. Clone an existing project using the /r/project/saveas call.
  3. Import a project archive using the /r/project/import call.

Saving Projects

There are a number of ways to save projects on the API, including the following:

  1. Save an existing project using the /r/project/save call.
  2. Clone an existing project using the /r/project/saveas call.
  3. Export a project archive using the /r/project/export call.

Closing Projects

To close a live project use the /r/project/close API call. Closing a live project (temporary or persistent) deactivates the project, which in turn removes it from the grid and releases all associated server runtime resources. Remember, that closing a temporary project will permanently delete that project.

Deleting Projects

To delete a persistent project, use the /r/project/delete API call.

Project Archives

A project archive is generated by exporting the entire state of a persistent project into a compressed archive file. To export a persistent project, use the /r/project/export API call. Once exported, this file resides outside of the DeployR server.

A user can import a project archive back into any compatible DeployR server in order to produce a new, persistent project. To import a persistent project, use the /r/project/import API call.

Project archives are useful both as a general backup mechanism and as a means of sharing work between colleagues, particularly colleagues working on different DeployR installations.

6.1.1 /r/project/create

This call creates a new project for the currently authenticated user.

If the projectname parameter is specified on the call, then the newly created project will be a persistent project . If the projectname parameter is omitted on the call, then the newly created project will be a temporary project . The projectdescr parameter is ignored if the projectname parameter is omitted.

The blackbox parameter ensures that calls on the temporary project are limited to the User Blackbox API Controls .

Using the inputs , preloadfile , preloadobject and adopt parameters the project can be pre-initialized with data in the workspace and/or working directory.

The inputs parameter allows the caller to pass DeployR-encoded R object values as inputs. These inputs are turned into R objects in the workspace of the new R session before the call returns.

The csvinputs parameter allows the caller to pass R object primitive values as comma-separated name/value pairs. These inputs are turned into R objects in the workspace before the execution begins.

The preloadbydirectory parameter allows the caller to load all files within one or more repository-managed directories into the working directory before the call returns.

The set of preloadfile parameters allow the caller to load one or more files from the repository into the working directory of the new R session before the call returns.

The set of preloadobject parameters allow the caller to load one or more binary R objects (.rData) from the repository into the workspace of the new R session before the call returns.

The set of adopt parameters allow the caller to load a pre-existing project workspace, project working directory and/or project package dependencies into the new R session before the call returns.

HTTP Method

POST

Request Format

Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=utf-8

Parameters

  • format – specifies markup encoding on the call: json or xml
  • cluster – _(optional) identifies a grid node cluster for targeted execution
  • projectname – (optional) names a new persistent project
  • projectdescr – (optional) describes a new persistent project
  • blackbox - (optional) when enabled, a temporary project is limited to user blackbox API controls
  • inputs - (optional) DeployR-encoded inputs
  • csvinputs - (optional) comma-separated list of primitive name/value inputs
  • preloadbydirectory - (optional) comma-separated list of repository directory names
  • preloadfilename - (optional) comma-separated list of repository filenames
  • preloadfiledirectory - (optional) comma-separated list of directories, one directory per preloadfilename
  • preloadfileauthor - (optional) comma-separated list of authors, one author per preloadfilename
  • preloadfileversion - (optional) comma-separated list of versions, one version per preloadfilename
  • preloadobjectname - (optional) comma-separated list of repository object (.rData) filenames
  • preloadobjectdirectory - (optional) comma-separated list of directories, one directory per preloadobjectname
  • preloadobjectauthor - (optional) comma-separated list of authors, one author per preloadobjectname
  • preloadobjectversion - (optional) comma-separated list of versions, one version per preloadobjectname
  • adoptworkspace – _(optional) identifies project from which workspace is to be adopted
  • adoptdirectory – _(optional) identifies project from which directory is to be adopted
  • adoptpackages – _(optional) identifies project from which package dependencies are to be adopted

Examples 

format=json
projectname=Demo Analysis
projectdescr=Predicting retail sales.
adoptworkspace=PROJECT-7a70bcd0-5b9b-4a83-805d-c4dd0aa51617

Response Markup (JSON)

{
    "deployr": {
        "response": {
            "call": "/r/project/create",
            "success": true,
            "project": {
                "project": "PROJECT-e2edd15f-dd67-42f6-8d82-90a2a5a669ca",
                "name": "Demo Analysis",
                "descr": "Predicting retail sales."
                "longdescr": null,
                "author": "george",
                "authors": [
                    "george"
                ],
                "shared": false,
                "origin": "Project original.",
                "lastmodified": 1378307180363,
                "live": true,
                "cookie": null
            },
            "httpcookie": "07D91F6C510E10ED84E6AC52CD0B6D1B"
        }
    }
}

Response Markup (XML)

<deployr>
  <response>
    <call>/r/project/create</call>
    <success>true</success>
    <project>
      <project>PROJECT-3d8cb9f1-def0-458b-bdf8-202b73077dc2</project>
      <name>Demo Analysis</name>
      <descr>Predicting retail sales.</descr>
      <longdescr/>
      <author>george</author>
      <authors>
        <author>george</author>
      </authors>
      <shared/>
      <origin>Project original.</origin>
      <lastmodified>1378307073917</lastmodified>
      <live>true</live>
      <cookie><![CDATA[  ]]></cookie>
    </project>
    <httpcookie>07D91F6C510E10ED84E6AC52CD0B6D1B</httpcookie>
  </response>
</deployr>

6.1.2 /r/project/pool

This call creates a pool of temporary projects for the currently authenticated user.

The caller can specify their preferred number of projects to create using the poolsize parameter. DeployR will attempt to create up to poolsize number of projects. However, standard server policy contraints apply to individual users and on the grid so there is no guarantee that poolsize projects will be returned. If the number of projects returned on this call is less than poolsize the caller can inspect the error and errorCode properties in the response markup to determine exactly why their pool size was limited.

The blackbox parameter ensures that calls on each project in the pool are limited to the User Blackbox API Controls .

Using the inputs , preloadfile , preloadobject and adopt parameters each project in the pool can be pre-initialized with data in the workspace and/or working directory.

The inputs parameter allows the caller to pass DeployR-encoded R object values as inputs. These inputs are turned into R objects in the workspace of the new R session before the call returns.

The csvinputs parameter allows the caller to pass R object primitive values as comma-separated name/value pairs. These inputs are turned into R objects in the workspace before the execution begins.

The preloadbydirectory parameter allows the caller to load all files within one or more repository-managed directories into the working directory before the call returns.

The set of preloadfile parameters allow the caller to load one or more files from the repository into the working directory of the new R session before the call returns.

The set of preloadobject parameters allow the caller to load one or more binary R objects (.rData) from the repository into the workspace of the new R session before the call returns.

The set of adopt parameters allow the caller to load a pre-existing project workspace, project working directory and/or project package dependencies into the new R session before the call returns.

HTTP Method

POST

Request Format

Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=utf-8

Parameters

  • format – specifies markup encoding on the call: json or xml
  • poolsize – the preferred size of the pool of temporary projects
  • cluster – _(optional) identifies a grid node cluster for targeted execution
  • blackbox - (optional) when enabled, each temporary project in the pool is limited to user blackbox API controls
  • inputs - (optional) DeployR-encoded inputs
  • csvinputs - (optional) comma-separated list of primitive name/value inputs
  • preloadbydirectory - (optional) comma-separated list of repository directory names
  • preloadfilename - (optional) comma-separated list of repository filenames
  • preloadfiledirectory - (optional) comma-separated list of directories, one directory per preloadfilename
  • preloadfileauthor - (optional) comma-separated list of authors, one author per preloadfilename
  • preloadfileversion - (optional) comma-separated list of versions, one version per preloadfilename
  • preloadobjectname - (optional) comma-separated list of repository object (.rData) filenames
  • preloadobjectdirectory - (optional) comma-separated list of directories, one directory per preloadobjectname
  • preloadobjectauthor - (optional) comma-separated list of authors, one author per preloadobjectname
  • preloadobjectversion - (optional) comma-separated list of versions, one version per pobject reloadobjectname
  • adoptworkspace – _(optional) identifies project from which workspace is to be adopted
  • adoptdirectory – _(optional) identifies project from which directory is to be adopted
  • adoptpackages – _(optional) identifies project from which package dependencies are to be adopted

Examples 

format=json
projectname=Demo Analysis
projectdescr=Predicting retail sales.
adoptworkspace=PROJECT-7a70bcd0-5b9b-4a83-805d-c4dd0aa51617

Response Markup (JSON)

{
    "deployr": {
        "response": {
            "call": "/r/project/create",
            "success": true,
            "project": {
                "project": "PROJECT-e2edd15f-dd67-42f6-8d82-90a2a5a669ca",
                "name": "Demo Analysis",
                "descr": "Predicting retail sales."
                "longdescr": null,
                "author": "george",
                "authors": [
                    "george"
                ],
                "shared": false,
                "origin": "Project original.",
                "lastmodified": 1378307180363,
                "live": true,
                "cookie": null
            },
            "httpcookie": "07D91F6C510E10ED84E6AC52CD0B6D1B"
        }
    }
}
{
    "deployr": {
        "response": {
            "call": "/r/project/pool",
            "success": true,
            "projects": [
                {
                    "project": "PROJECT-cc5434fc-3c8c-426d-a2a3-f2d9d8c978d5",

6.1.3 /r/project/recycle

This call recycles the R session associated with the project by deleting all R objects from the workspace and all files from the working directory.

Recycling a project is a convenient and efficient alternative to starting over by closing an existing project and then creating a new project.

HTTP Method

POST

Request Format

Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=utf-8

Parameters

  • format – specifies markup encoding on the call: json or xml
  • project – specifies the project identifier
  • preserveworkspace - (optional) if true, the objects in the workspace are preserved on refresh
  • preservedirectory - (optional) if true, the files in the working directory are preserved on refresh

Examples 

format=json
project=PROJECT-e2edd15f-dd67-42f6-8d82-90a2a5a669ca

Response Markup (JSON)

{
    "deployr": {
        "response": {
            "success": true,
            "call": "/r/project/recycle",
            "project": {
                "project": "PROJECT-e2edd15f-dd67-42f6-8d82-90a2a5a669ca",
                "name": null,
                "descr": null,
                "longdescr": null,
                "author": "george",
                "authors": [
                    "george"
                ],
                "shared": false,
                "lastmodified": 1378307713478,
                "live": false,
                "cookie": null,
                "origin": "Project original."
            },
            "httpcookie": "07D91F6C510E10ED84E6AC52CD0B6D1B"
        }
    }
}

Response Markup (XML)

<deployr>
  <response>
    <call>/r/project/recycle</call>
    <success>true</success>
    <project>
      <project>PROJECT-e2edd15f-dd67-42f6-8d82-90a2a5a669ca</project>
      <name/>
      <descr/>
      <longdescr/>
      <author>george</author>
      <authors>
        <author>george</author>
      </authors>
      <shared/>
      <cookie><![CDATA[  ]]></cookie>
      <lastmodified>1378307812842</lastmodified>
      <live/>
      <origin>Project original.</origin>
    </project>
    <httpcookie>07D91F6C510E10ED84E6AC52CD0B6D1B</httpcookie>
  </response>
</deployr>

6.1.4 /r/project/list

This call lists all projects owned by the currently authenticated user and/or all projects shared by other users.

Shared projects are available as read-only projects to the caller. The shared or private nature of a project can be controlled using the /r/project/about/update call.

HTTP Method

GET

Request Format

Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=utf-8

Parameters

  • format – specifies markup encoding on the call: json or xml
  • sharedprojectsalso – (optional) when true, the project response list contains the caller's projects plus projects shared by other users
  • sharedprojectsonly – (optional) when true, the project response list contains only projects shared by other users and not the users's own projects
  • isordered – (optional) when true, the project response list is ordered in a most-recently-modified first order. Otherwise the list is ordered chronologically by creation date

Examples 

format=json
isordered=true

Response Markup (JSON)

{
    "deployr": {
        "response": {
            "call": "/r/project/list",
            "success": true,
            "projects": [
                {
                    "project": "PROJECT-e2edd15f-dd67-42f6-8d82-90a2a5a669ca",
                    "name": "Demo Analysis",
                    "descr": "Predicting retail sales.",
                    "longdescr": null,
                    "author": "george",
                    "authors": [
                        "george"
                    ],
                    "shared": false,
                    "lastmodified": 1378307321841,
                    "live": false,
                    "cookie": null,
                    "origin": "Project original."
                },
                {
                    "project": "PROJECT-8aaa65ab-db33-4a28-b351-579705f5ead9",
                    "name": "Demo Graphics",
                    "descr": null,
                    "longdescr": null,
                    "author": "george",
                    "authors": [
                        "george"
                    ],
                    "shared": false,
                    "lastmodified": 1378307321842,
                    "live": false,
                    "cookie": null,
                    "origin": "Project original."
                }
            ],
            "httpcookie": "07D91F6C510E10ED84E6AC52CD0B6D1B"
        }
    }
}

Response Markup (XML)

<deployr>
  <response>
    <call>/r/project/list</call>
    <success>true</success>
    <projects>
      <project>
        <project>PROJECT-e2edd15f-dd67-42f6-8d82-90a2a5a669ca</project>
        <name>Demo Analysis</name>
        <descr>Predicting retail sales.</descr>
        <longdescr/>
        <author>george</author>
        <authors>
          <author>george</author>
        </authors>
        <shared/>
        <lastmodified>1378307465228</lastmodified>
        <live/>
        <cookie><![CDATA[  ]]></cookie>
        <origin>Project original.</origin>
      </project>
      <project>
        <project>PROJECT-8aaa65ab-db33-4a28-b351-579705f5ead9</project>
        <name>Demo Graphics</name>
        <descr/>
        <longdescr/>
        <author>george</author>
        <authors>
          <author>george</author>
        </authors>
        <shared/>
        <lastmodified>1378307465228</lastmodified>
        <cookie><![CDATA[  ]]></cookie>
        <live/>
        <origin>Project original.</origin>
      </project>
    </projects>
    <httpcookie>07D91F6C510E10ED84E6AC52CD0B6D1B</httpcookie>
  </response>
</deployr>

6.1.5 /r/project/ping

This call pings the specified project to determine if the project is live on the DeployR grid.

HTTP Method

GET

Request Format

Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=utf-8

Parameters

  • format – specifies markup encoding on the call: json or xml
  • project – specifies the project identifier

Examples 

format=json
project=PROJECT-e2edd15f-dd67-42f6-8d82-90a2a5a669ca

Response Markup (JSON)

{
    "deployr": {
        "response": {
            "call": "/r/project/ping",
            "success": true,
            "project": {
                "project": "PROJECT-e2edd15f-dd67-42f6-8d82-90a2a5a669ca",
                "name": "Demo Analysis",
                "descr": "Predicting retail sales."
                "longdescr": null,
                "author": "george",
                "authors": [
                    "george"
                ],
                "shared": false,
                "lastmodified": 1378307626647,
                "live": false,
                "cookie": null,
                "origin": "Project original."
            },
            "httpcookie": "07D91F6C510E10ED84E6AC52CD0B6D1B"
        }
    }
}

Response Markup (XML)

<deployr>
  <response>
    <call>/r/project/ping</call>
    <success>true</success>
    <httpcookie>07D91F6C510E10ED84E6AC52CD0B6D1B</httpcookie>
    <project>
      <project>PROJECT-e2edd15f-dd67-42f6-8d82-90a2a5a669ca</project>
      <name>Demo Analysis</name>
      <descr>Predicting retail sales.</descr>
      <longdescr/>
      <author>george</author>
      <authors>
        <author>george</author>
      </authors>
      <shared/>
      <lastmodified>1378307570167</lastmodified>
      <live/>
      <cookie><![CDATA[  ]]></cookie>
      <origin>Project original.</origin>
    </project>
  </response>
</deployr>

6.1.6 /r/project/about

This call retrieves a set of properties that describe the specified project.

HTTP Method

GET

Request Format

Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=utf-8

Parameters

  • format – specifies markup encoding on the call: json or xml
  • project – specifies the project identifier

Examples 

format=json
project=PROJECT-e2edd15f-dd67-42f6-8d82-90a2a5a669ca

Response Markup (JSON)

{
    "deployr": {
        "response": {
            "success": true,
            "call": "/r/project/about",
            "project": {
                "project": "PROJECT-e2edd15f-dd67-42f6-8d82-90a2a5a669ca",
                "name": "Demo Analysis",
                "descr": "Predicting retail sales."
                "longdescr": null,
                "author": "george",
                "authors": [
                    "george"
                ],
                "shared": false,
                "lastmodified": 1378307713478,
                "live": false,
                "cookie": null,
                "origin": "Project original."
            },
            "httpcookie": "07D91F6C510E10ED84E6AC52CD0B6D1B"
        }
    }
}

Response Markup (XML)

<deployr>
  <response>
    <call>/r/project/about</call>
    <success>true</success>
    <project>
      <project>PROJECT-e2edd15f-dd67-42f6-8d82-90a2a5a669ca</project>
      <name>Demo Analysis</name>
      <descr>Predicting retail sales.</descr>
      <longdescr/>
      <author>george</author>
      <authors>
        <author>george</author>
      </authors>
      <shared/>

      <live/>
      <origin>Project original.</origin>
    </project>
    <httpcookie>07D91F6C510E10ED84E6AC52CD0B6D1B</httpcookie>
  </response>
</deployr>

6.1.7 /r/project/about/update

This call updates a set of properties that describe the specified project.

HTTP Method

POST

Request Format

Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=utf-8

Parameters

  • format – specifies markup encoding on the call: json or xml
  • project – specifies the project identifier
  • name – specifies the project name
  • descr – (optional) specifies the project description
  • longdescr – (optional) specifies the project long description
  • shared – (optional) if true, specifies that the project is a shared project
  • projectcookie – (optional) specifies a client-application specific project cookie

Examples 

format=json
project=PROJECT-e2edd15f-dd67-42f6-8d82-90a2a5a669ca
name=Demo Analysis
descr=Predicting retail sales, updated.

Response Markup (JSON)

{
    "deployr": {
        "response": {
            "call": "/r/project/about/update",
            "success": true,
            "project": {
                "project": "PROJECT-e2edd15f-dd67-42f6-8d82-90a2a5a669ca",
                "name": "Demo Analysis",
                "descr": "Predicting retail sales, updated."
                "longdescr": null,
                "author": "george",
                "authors": [
                    "george"
                ],
                "shared": false,
                "lastmodified": 1378307912517,
                "live": false,
                "cookie": null,
                "origin": "Project original."
            },
            "httpcookie": "07D91F6C510E10ED84E6AC52CD0B6D1B"
        }
    }
}

Response Markup (XML)

<deployr>
  <response>
    <call>/r/project/about/update</call>
    <success>true</success>
    <project>
      <project>PROJECT-e2edd15f-dd67-42f6-8d82-90a2a5a669ca</project>
      <name>Demo Analysis</name>
      <descr>Predicting retail sales, updated.</descr>
      <longdescr/>
      <author>george</author>
      <authors>
        <author>george</author>
      </authors>
      <shared/>
      <lastmodified>1378307912512</lastmodified>
      <live/>
      <cookie><![CDATA[  ]]></cookie>
      <origin>Project original.</origin>
    </project>
    <httpcookie>07D91F6C510E10ED84E6AC52CD0B6D1B</httpcookie>
  </response>
</deployr>

6.1.8 /r/project/save

This call saves the persistent state of the specified project.

The set of drop parameters allows the caller to selectively drop aspects, such as workspace, working directory, or execution history of the project state when saving. The flushhistory parameter allows the caller to preserve the project execution history itself while destroying all generated console output and results associated with that history.

HTTP Method

POST

Request Format

Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=utf-8

Parameters

  • format – specifies markup encoding on the call: json or xml
  • project - specifies the project identifier
  • name – (optional) specifies the project name
  • descr – (optional) specifies the project description
  • longdescr – (optional) specifies the project long description
  • shared – (optional) if true, specifies that the project is a shared project
  • projectcookie – (optional) specifies a client-application specific project cookie
  • dropworkspace - (optional) if true, the content of the project's workspace is dropped on save
  • dropdirectory - (optional) if true, the content of the project's working directory is dropped on save
  • drophistory - (optional) if true, the project's execution history is dropped on save
  • flushhistory - (optional) if true, the project's execution history is flushed on save

Examples 

format=json
project=PROJECT-1bdc9034-f86a-46d5-9a5c-4b439efe2fe6
name=Demo Analysis
projectdescr=Predicting retail sales, saved.

Response Markup (JSON)

{
    "deployr": {
        "response": {
            "call": "/r/project/save",
            "success": true,
            "project": {
                "project": "PROJECT-e2edd15f-dd67-42f6-8d82-90a2a5a669ca",
                "name": "Demo Analysis",
                "descr": "Predicting retail sales, saved."
                "longdescr": null,
                "author": "george",
                "authors": [
                    "george"
                ],
                "shared": false,
                "lastmodified": 1378307912517,
                "live": false,
                "cookie": null,
                "origin": "Project original."
            },
            "httpcookie": "07D91F6C510E10ED84E6AC52CD0B6D1B"
        }
    }
}

Response Markup (XML)

<deployr>
  <response>
    <call>/r/project/save</call>
    <success>true</success>
    <project>
      <project>PROJECT-e2edd15f-dd67-42f6-8d82-90a2a5a669ca</project>
      <name>Demo Analysis</name>
      <descr>Predicting retail sales, saved.</descr>
      <longdescr/>
      <author>george</author>
      <authors>
        <author>george</author>
      </authors>
      <shared/>
      <lastmodified>1378307912517</lastmodified>
      <live/>
      <cookie><![CDATA[  ]]></cookie>
      <origin>Project original.</origin>
    </project>
    <httpcookie>07D91F6C510E10ED84E6AC52CD0B6D1B</httpcookie>
  </response>
</deployr>

6.1.9 /r/project/saveas

This call saves the persistent state of the specified project to a new persistent project.

The set of drop parameters allows the caller to selectively drop aspects, such as workspace, working directory, or execution history of the project state when saving to the new project. The flushhistory parameter allows the caller to preserve the project execution history itself for the new project while dropping all generated console output and results associated with the original history.

HTTP Method

POST

Request Format

Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=utf-8

Parameters

  • format – specifies markup encoding on the call: json or xml
  • project - specifies the project identifier
  • name – specifies the new project name
  • descr – (optional) specifies the new project description
  • longdescr – (optional) specifies the new project long description
  • shared – (optional) if true, specifies that the new project is a shared project
  • projectcookie – (optional) specifies a client-application specific cookie for the new project
  • dropworkspace - (optional) if true, the content of the original project's workspace is dropped when saving to the new project
  • dropdirectory - (optional) if true, the content of the project's working directory is dropped when saving to the new project
  • drophistory - (optional) if true, the project's execution history is dropped when saving to the new project
  • flushhistory - (optional) if true, the project's execution history is flushed when saving to the new project

Examples 

format=json
project=PROJECT-1bdc9034-f86a-46d5-9a5c-4b439efe2fe6
name=Demo Analysis Snapshot
projectdescr=Predicting retail sales, snapshot September 4, 2013.

Response Markup (JSON)

{
    "deployr": {
        "response": {
            "call": "/r/project/saveas",
            "success": true,
            "project": {
                "project": "PROJECT-d9bd18da-0e15-49e4-96fd-4cb636aff6e7",
                "name": "Demo Analysis Snapshot",
                "descr": "Predicting retail sales, snapshot September 4, 2013."
                "longdescr": null,
                "author": "george",
                "authors": [
                    "george"
                ],
                "shared": false,
                "lastmodified": 1378308383791,
                "live": false,
                "cookie": null,
                "origin": "Project copied from project named,  Demo Analysis."
            },
            "httpcookie": "07D91F6C510E10ED84E6AC52CD0B6D1B"
        }
    }
}

Response Markup (XML)

<deployr>
  <response>
    <call>/r/project/saveas</call>
    <success>true</success>
    <httpcookie>07D91F6C510E10ED84E6AC52CD0B6D1B</httpcookie>
    <project>
      <project>PROJECT-431f0e14-aeed-4e6c-a10e-c6a4535174da</project>
      <name>Demo Analysis Snapshot</name>
      <descr>Predicting retail sales, snapshot September 4, 2013.</descr>
      <longdescr/>
      <author>george</author>
      <authors>
        <author>george</author>
      </authors>
      <shared/>
      <lastmodified>1378308345217</lastmodified>
      <live/>
      <cookie><![CDATA[  ]]></cookie>
      <origin>Project copied from project named,  Demo Analysis.</origin>
    </project>
  </response>
</deployr>

6.1.10 /r/project/close

This call closes the specified project.

Closing a live project releases all resources associated with the project on the DeployR grid. If the specified project is a persistent project then the default autosave semantics will cause the project to be saved automatically. The caller can override that default behavior using the disableautosave parameter.

The set of drop parameters allow the caller to selectively drop aspects, such as workspace, working directory, or execution history, of the project state when closing. The flushhistory parameter allows the caller to preserve the project execution history itself while destroying all generated console output and results associated with that history.

HTTP Method

POST

Request Format

Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=utf-8

Parameters

  • format – specifies markup encoding on the call: json or xml
  • project - specifies the project identifier
  • disableautosave - (optional) if true, the default autosave semantics for persistent projects are disabled
  • projectcookie – (optional) specifies a client-application specific project cookie
  • dropworkspace - (optional) if true, the content of the project's workspace is dropped on close
  • dropdirectory - (optional) if true, the content of the project's working directory is dropped on close
  • drophistory - (optional) if true, the project's execution history is dropped on close
  • flushhistory - (optional) if true, the project's execution history is flushed on close

Examples 

format=json
project=PROJECT-e2edd15f-dd67-42f6-8d82-90a2a5a669ca

Response Markup (JSON)

{
    "deployr": {
        "response": {
            "call": "/r/project/close",
            "success": true,
            "project": {
                "project": "PROJECT-e2edd15f-dd67-42f6-8d82-90a2a5a669ca",
                "name": "Demo Analysis",
                "descr": "Predicting retail sales, updated."
                "longdescr": null,
                "author": "george",
                "authors": [
                    "george"
                ],
                "shared": false,
                "lastmodified": 1378307912517,
                "cookie": null,
                "origin": "Project original.",
            },
            "httpcookie": "07D91F6C510E10ED84E6AC52CD0B6D1B"
        }
    }
}

Response Markup (XML)

<deployr>
  <response>
    <call>/r/project/close</call>
    <success>true</success>
    <project>
      <project>PROJECT-e2edd15f-dd67-42f6-8d82-90a2a5a669ca</project>
      <name>Demo Analysis</name>
      <descr>Predicting retail sales, updated.</descr>
      <longdescr/>
      <author>george</author>
      <authors>
        <author>george</author>
      </authors>
      <shared/>
      <lastmodified>1378307912517</lastmodified>
      <cookie><![CDATA[  ]]></cookie>
      <origin>Project original.</origin>
    </project>
    <httpcookie>07D91F6C510E10ED84E6AC52CD0B6D1B</httpcookie>
  </response>
</deployr>

6.1.11 /r/project/grant

This call grants authorship of the specified project to other users.

Refer to the section Introducing Projects for a detailed description of project collaboration and the workflows facilitated by grants.

HTTP Method

POST

Request Format

Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=utf-8

Parameters

  • format – specifies markup encoding on the call: json or xml
  • project - specifies the project identifier
  • newauthor – specifies a comma-separated list of usernames indicating the new owners

Examples 

format=json
project=PROJECT-e2edd15f-dd67-42f6-8d82-90a2a5a669ca
newauthor=testuser

Response Markup (JSON)

{
    "deployr": {
        "response": {
            "call": "/r/project/grant",
            "success": true,
            "project": {
                "project": "PROJECT-e2edd15f-dd67-42f6-8d82-90a2a5a669ca",
                "name": "Demo Analysis",
                "descr": "Predicting retail sales, updated."
                "longdescr": null,
                "author": "george",
                "authors": [
                    "george",
                    "testuser"
                ],
                "shared": false,
                "lastmodified": 1378308723041,
                "live": false,
                "cookie": null,
                "origin": "Project original.",
            },
            "httpcookie": "07D91F6C510E10ED84E6AC52CD0B6D1B"
        }
    }
}

Response Markup (XML)

<deployr>
  <response>
    <call>/r/project/grant</call>
    <success>true</success>
    <project>
      <project>PROJECT-e2edd15f-dd67-42f6-8d82-90a2a5a669ca</project>
      <name>Demo Analysis</name>
      <descr>Predicting retail sales, updated.</descr>
      <longdescr/>
      <author>george</author>
      <authors>
        <author>george</author>
        <author>testuser</author>
      <shared/>
      </authors>
      <lastmodified>1378307912517</lastmodified>
      <live/>
      <cookie><![CDATA[  ]]></cookie>
      <origin>Project original.</origin>
    </project>
    <httpcookie>07D91F6C510E10ED84E6AC52CD0B6D1B</httpcookie>
  </response>
</deployr>

6.1.12 /r/project/import

This call imports the specified project archive as a new persistent project.

HTTP Method

POST

Request Format

Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=utf-8

Parameters

  • format – specifies markup encoding on the call: json or xml
  • name - specifies the name of the project archive file
  • file - ...file content...
  • descr - (optional) specifies a description for the newly imported project

Examples 

format=json
name=deployr-project-archive.zip 
file= ...file content…
descr=Import of latest sales projections.

Response Markup (JSON)

{
    "deployr": {
        "response": {
            "call": "/r/project/import",
            "success": true,
            "project": {
                "project": "PROJECT-13b396fb-c6fc-4555-bd87-c824efb5fa02",
                "name": "Sample Sales Projects (Import)",
                "descr": "Import of latests sales projections."
                "longdescr": null,
                "author": "testuser",
                "authors": [
                    "testuser"
                ],
                "shared": false,
                "lastmodified": 1378313402230,
                "live": true,
                "cookie": null,
                "origin": "Project generated on import of project named,  Sample Sales Projects.",
            },
            "httpcookie": "4BA64A04F9AE3B0DED3D47AC7E2239F0"
        }
    }
}

Response Markup (XML)

<deployr>
  <response>
    <call>/r/project/import</call>
    <success>true</success>
    <project>
      <project>PROJECT-ad695add-71ef-4f4e-a423-44bf8a2c4784</project>
      <name>Sample Sales Projects (Import)</name>
      <descr>Import of latests sales projections.</descr>
      <longdescr/>
      <author>testuser</author>
      <authors>
        <author>testuser</author>
      </authors>
      <shared/>
      <lastmodified>1378314283859</lastmodified>
      <live/>
      <cookie><![CDATA[  ]]></cookie>
      <origin>Project generated on import of project named,  Sample Sales Projects.</origin>
    </project>
    <httpcookie>8E2D45EBBF724EB3C1FE1F9CEE1D39A1</httpcookie>
  </response>
</deployr>

6.1.13 /r/project/export

This call exports a compressed archive file for the specified project.

The set of drop parameters allow the caller to selectively drop aspects, such as workspace, working directory, or execution history of the project state when generating the archive. The flushhistory parameter allows the caller to preserve the project execution history itself while excluding all generated console output and results associated with that history.

HTTP Method

POST

Request Format

Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=utf-8

Parameters

  • format – specifies markup encoding on the call: json or xml
  • project - specifies project identifier
  • dropworkspace - (optional) if true, the content of the project's workspace is dropped on export
  • dropdirectory - (optional) if true, the content of the project's working directory is dropped on export
  • drophistory - (optional) if true, the project's execution history is dropped on export
  • flushhistory - (optional) if true, the project's execution history is flushed on export

Examples 

format=json
project=PROJECT-26187700-b67f-44d3-9c72-2d4250944424

Response

Content-Type: application/zip

6.1.14 /r/project/delete

This call deletes the specified project.

Deleting a project is a permanent operation that cannot be undone or recovered.

Refer to the section Introducing Projects for a detailed description of project collaboration and the implications of deleting a project with mutiple authors.

HTTP Method

POST

Request Format

Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=utf-8

Parameters

  • format – specifies markup encoding on the call: json or xml
  • project - specifies the project identifier

Examples 

format=json
project=PROJECT-ad695add-71ef-4f4e-a423-44bf8a2c4784

Response Markup (JSON)

{
    "deployr": {
        "response": {
            "call": "/r/project/delete",
            "success": true,
            "project": {
                "project": "PROJECT-ad695add-71ef-4f4e-a423-44bf8a2c4784",
                "name": "Demo Analysis",
                "descr": "Predicting retail sales.",
                "longdescr": null,
                "author": "testuser",
                "authors": [
                    "testuser"
                ],
                "shared": false,
                "live": false,
                "lastmodified": 1378314603947,
                "cookie": null
                "origin": "Project original.",
            },
            "httpcookie": "8E2D45EBBF724EB3C1FE1F9CEE1D39A1"
        }
    }
}

Response Markup (XML)

<deployr>
  <response>
    <call>/r/project/delete</call>
    <success>true</success>
    <project>
      <project>PROJECT-ad695add-71ef-4f4e-a423-44bf8a2c4784</project>
      <name>Demo Analysis</name>
      <descr>Predicting retail sales.</descr>
      <longdescr/>
      <author>testuser</author>
      <authors>
        <author>testuser</author>
      </authors>
      <shared/>
      <lastmodified>1378314481089</lastmodified>
      <live/>
      <cookie><![CDATA[  ]]></cookie>
      <origin>Project original.</origin>
    </project>
    <httpcookie>8E2D45EBBF724EB3C1FE1F9CEE1D39A1</httpcookie>
  </response>
</deployr>
